column16: This is a significant HL7 gap. This subject has generated many client debates. Document creation generally falls into two modes, manually created, and autogenerated based off a system trigger event e.g. discharge.  The system generating the document depending on configuration may or may not include information. The resulting document may not accurately be able to state if information was known absent or not known.  If you ask a physician either statement alone raises concern. If its known absent why was it withheld? If its not known why? Was the patient refusing?    I'd like to suggest a third option that combines the two statements, e.g. Excluded / Not available
column17: I'd like to suggest a third option that combines the two statements, e.g. Excluded / Not available

There is a pregnancy Ballot running concurrently with this one. 
CDAR2_IG_PREGNANCY_R1_D1_2018MAY  
Please consider adopting additional information for this document. Pregnancy unfortunately can be high risk involving two + lives.  
In particular:
Aborta, Date of First Prenatal Care Visit, Date of last live birth, detailed estimated date of delivery, estimated gestational age of pregnancy. Gravida, Parity, Pregnancy observation

column14: The international patient summary is specified either as templated document using HL7 CDA R2, either as HL7 FHIR composition (described in this guide)
column15: The international patient summary is specified as a templated document using HL7 CDA R2 (reference needed). This implementation guide describes the profiles of FHIR resources that represent the IPS Data Set.
column16: It makes no sense to have two formats for the IPS. The CDA R2 format is specifically designed for representing documents, which is one of the distinguishing characterstics of the IPS. A FHIR implementation guide on representing the IPS data set as FHIR resources can be useful for providing the means fot buidling an IPS CDA dcoument from a variety of FHIR-enabled sources, but there is no value, at least for now, to provide an alternative document format.
column17: It makes no sense to have two formats for the IPS.
